pages.text: In the wild, rocks can be found in nearly every biome on the planet.$(br2)In certain areas, rocks may pile on top of each other in mounds sometimes referred to as 'hills'. If enough rocks group together, they can even achieve a new classification called 'mountains'.$(br2)However, most rocks prefer to

live underground, usually with several layers of dirt between them and natural sunlight.$(br2)Pet Rocksâ„¢ are a breed of small rock often found on the surface of mountains.$(br2)This means that they are much less sedimentary than underground breeds, but come with their own unique challenges.
